result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Lee Anderson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.

9:15 AM Cases 22CF95, 22CF199, 22TR284-286 called together.  Defendant Ronald Lee Anderson in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Ronald Lee Anderson.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case 22CF199 set for prelim, will be waiving.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case 22CF199 proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Atty Anderson notes offer has been received, wants to review discovery.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:37 AM Cases 22CF199, 2022CF000095, 2022TR000284, 2022TR000285, and 2022TR000286 called together.  Defendant Ronald Lee Anderson in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Ronald Lee Anderson.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF199 was set for prelim, but attorney has not been appointed on this case, so he cannot represent today for a preliminary hearing (def contacted PD this morning).  Court notes witness appears ready, willing, and able to testify; addresses the defendant.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:46 AM Cases 22CF95, 22CF199, 2022TR000284, 2022TR000285, and 2022TR000286 called together.  Defendant Ronald Lee Anderson in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Ronald Lee Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case 22CF199 on for an Initial Appearance.  Court advises def needs to contact PD's office and get his attorney on that case also.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant

Defendant must post $250 additional cash, for a total of $500 cash to be posted to cover Burnett County Cases 22GF205 and 22CF95.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
